title: Quick & Easy Ways to Factory Reset Your Wireless Bose Color Soundlink

steps.title: Press the Aux and - buttons.
steps.content: Press the Aux and - buttons. You should find these buttons on the top side of the speaker. This model was sold between 2014 and 2019.

steps.title: Hold the buttons down for 15 seconds.
steps.content: Hold the buttons down for 15 seconds. You will hear a tone.

steps.title: Release the buttons.
steps.content: Release the buttons. Your speaker will be returned to factory default conditions. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button. It should be at the top of the speaker in the far corner. This speaker doesn't have an AUX button like the OG counterpart. The speaker should be on before you reset it.

steps.title: Hold the button for 10 seconds.
steps.content: Hold the button for 10 seconds. You'll see the Bluetooth light blink blue, and a voice prompt will ask you to select a language.

steps.title: Release the Power button.
steps.content: Release the Power button. Pick a language, and your speaker will reset! [2] X Research source

steps.title: What if the factory reset isn't working?
steps.content: What if the factory reset isn't working? You might need to try a hard reset, which means you need to: Plug it into a power source Press and hold the Play/Pause button for 15 seconds. Disconnect it from power Release the Play/Pause button Reconnect it to power

steps.title: What do I do if the speaker won't turn on?
steps.content: What do I do if the speaker won't turn on? Make sure you're using the power supply that came with your speaker. Using another may cause it not to work. You should also plug it in with an AC cord instead of using the battery if that's the case (if you have had it for a long time, the battery could have decayed so much that it won't run on battery power alone). If the speaker hasn't been used for at least 14 days or more, it starts Battery Protection Mode, to preserve the battery. To get out of Battery Protection Mode, connect to A/C power, and the system will reactivate. [3] X Research source

steps.title: How do I connect the Bose SoundLink Mini to my smartphone or tablet?
steps.content: How do I connect the Bose SoundLink Mini to my smartphone or tablet? Plug in and turn on your Bose Soundlink Mini, then press the Bluetooth button until the lights flash blue. In your phone's Bluetooth settings, tap the speaker to connect it . When successfully connected, the speaker will make a chime noise.

steps.title: Why is my Bose SoundLink Color not working?
steps.content: Why is my Bose SoundLink Color not working? There are various reasons for this, as well as multiple answers. Make sure the speaker is updated Reset it following the above steps Make sure you're connecting to the correct Bluetooth device.

steps.title: Why is my Bose SoundLink Color not connecting via Bluetooth?
steps.content: Why is my Bose SoundLink Color not connecting via Bluetooth? Bluetooth has a pretty short range, so make sure you're at most 6ft away. You'll also experience this issue if there are too many devices connected to Bluetooth. Bluetooth might've timed out, so make sure it is still on by pressing and holding the Bluetooth button until the LED blinks blue.
